tool.name: MACS2 bdgpeakcall
tool.command: macs2 bdgpeakcall --ifile '${ infile }' --cutoff '${ cutoff }' --min-length '${ minlen }' --max-gap '${ maxgap }' ${ cutoff_analysis } ${ notrackline } --ofile '${ outfile }'

param.name: cutoff
param.label: Cutoff for peaks
param.help: Cutoff depends on which method you used for score track. If the file contains pvalue scores from MACS2, score 5 means pvalue 1e-5. Default=5.0 (--cutoff)

param.name: minlen
param.label: Minimum length of peak
param.help: better to set it as d value. Default=200 (--min-length)

param.name: maxgap
param.label: Maximum gap between significant points in a peak
param.help: better to set it as tag size Default=30 (--max-gap)

param.name: cutoff_analysis
param.label: Perform cutoff analysis
param.help: While set, bdgpeakcall will analyze number or total length of peaks that can be called by different cutoff then output a summary table to help user decide a better cutoff. Note, --min-len and --max-gap may affect the results. Default=False (--cutoff-analysis)

tool.help:
**What it does**
This is **bdgpeakcall** utility from the MACS2_ Package. It calls peaks from bedGraph output.
.. _MACS2: https://github.com/taoliu/MACS
@citation@
